videos.article_title: 'Hopefully that's the last word on this case': Van Breda leave to appeal turned down
videos.description: Judge Siraj Desai denied Henri van Breda’s application for leave to appeal his three life sentences after being found guilty of triple murder on his family, and attempted murder of his sister. National Prosecuting Authority spokesperson Eric Ntabazalila spoke outside the Western Cape High Court after the proceedings on August 20 2018.
videos.author: Multimedia LIVE

videos.article_title: 'The evidence fits together like a mosaic': Judge holds out little hope for Van Breda appeal bid
videos.description: Judge Siraj Desai laid into Henri van Breda’s defence advocate, Piet Botha, during an application for leave to appeal against his convictions and three life sentences. Van Breda is serving his sentences in Drakenstein prison in the Western Cape. Desai will announce his decision on the application for leave to appeal on Monday August 20 2018.
videos.author: Multimedia LIVE

meta.description: Judge Siraj Desai laid into Henri van Breda’s defence advocate, Piet Botha, during an application for leave to appeal against his convictions and three life sentences. videos.article_title: IN FULL | Goodbye Shaun Abrahams - read the ConCourt judgment here
videos.description: South Africa’s highest court ruled on August 13 2018 that Advocate Shaun Abrahams was not validly appointed to lead the National Prosecuting Authority (NPA) because he had benefited from former President Jacob Zuma’s abuse of power. Justice Mbuyiseli Madlanga, writing on behalf of the Constitutional Court’s majority, found that Zuma had used a R17,3 million “golden handshake” to get rid of former NPA head Mxolisi Nxasana.
videos.author: Multimedia LIVE

meta.description: South Africa’s highest court ruled on August 13 2018 that Advocate Shaun Abrahams was not validly appointed to lead the National Prosecuting Authority (NPA) because he had benefited from former President Jacob Zuma’s abuse of power. Justice Mbuyiseli Madlanga, writing on behalf of the Constitutional Court’s majority, found that Zuma had used a R17,3 million “golden handshake” to get rid of former NPA head Mxolisi Nxasana.
meta.title: Zuma’s golden handshake costs Shaun Abrahams his job as NPA boss

image.description: South Africa’s highest court ruled on August 13 2018 that Advocate Shaun Abrahams was not validly appointed to lead the National Prosecuting Authority (NPA) because he had benefited from former President Jacob Zuma’s abuse of power. Justice Mbuyiseli Madlanga, writing on behalf of the Constitutional Court’s majority, found that Zuma had used a R17,3-million “golden handshake” to get rid of former NPA head Mxolisi Nxasana.
image.title: Zuma’s golden handshake costs Shaun Abrahams his job as NPA boss

listing.author: Multimedia LIVE
listing.description: South Africa’s highest court ruled on August 13 2018 that Advocate Shaun Abrahams was not validly appointed to lead the National Prosecuting Authority (NPA) because he had benefited from former President Jacob Zuma’s abuse of power. Justice Mbuyiseli Madlanga, writing on behalf of the Constitutional Court’s majority, found that Zuma had used a R17,3 million “golden handshake” to get rid of former NPA head Mxolisi Nxasana.
listing.title: Zuma’s golden handshake costs Shaun Abrahams his job as NPA boss
